channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Co-op shooter 'Aliens: Fireteam Elite' heads to consoles and PC on August 24th
item.description: 20th Century Games will release three-player co-op shooter Aliens: Fireteam Elite on August 24th.

item.title: Supreme Court rules that ‘F--- school’ is free speech in student Snapchat case
item.description: The Supreme Court ruled today that a high school in Pennsylvania violated a student's First Amendment rights by suspending her from the cheerleading team, following Snapchat posts where she criticized the school with expletives.

item.title: Netflix’s ‘Sexy Beasts’ puts hot people in furry prosthetics for blind dates
item.description: Sexy Beasts puts singles together on blind dates — but the twist is they're all wearing serious prosthetics and makeup

item.title: This could be Samsung's first Wear OS Galaxy Watch
item.description: A leak purports to show the Galaxy Watch Active 4, which might be Samsung's first smartwatch using the new Wear OS.

item.title: The 'Space Jam' sequel is getting a free tie-in game in July
item.description: Beat up some robots with LeBron James, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny.

item.title: EA buys the creators of mobile hit 'Golf Clash' for $1.4 billion
item.description: EA has bought Playdemic, the creator of 'Golf Clash,' for $1.4 billion as it dives deeper into mobile sports games.

item.title: This engine is up to 10 times smaller than diesel piston engines but much more efficient
item.description: LiquidPiston X-Engines reduce greenhouse gas emissions than traditional gasoline and diesel-powered engines without sacrificing performance.

item.title: 'Tribes of Midgard' blends survival, RPG and co-op mechanics for a new kind of Viking game
item.description: There aren't enough video game genres to describe 'Tribes of Midgard.'

item.title: US seizes Iranian websites over disinformation claims
item.description: The US government has seized 33 websites owned by the Iranian Islamic Radio and Television Union (IRTVU), as well as three other sites owned by Iraqi-based Kata’ib Hizballah (KH), after the groups violated US sanctions, the Department of Justice said in a statement yesterday.

item.title: Take a look back at Engadget's favorite Nintendo 64 games
item.description: The Engadget staff shares some of their favorite memories of the console on its 25th birthday.

item.title: Gogoro teams with Foxconn to make its e-scooters available worldwide
item.description: Gogoro has struck a deal with Foxconn that will help it make battery-swappable e-scooters available worldwide.

item.title: NVIDIA's Canvas app turns doodles into AI-generated 'photos'
item.description: NVIDIA has launched Canvas, a new app that can turn doodles into photorealistic landscape images.

item.title: Apple defends the App Store ahead of antitrust debates
item.description: A 16-page letter explains that without Apple's protections, the iPhone would become a security hellscape.

item.title: Bird reveals its own e-bike as it moves into bikesharing
item.description: Bird Bikes will arrive in several North American and European cities this year.

item.title: The Morning After: Finally, a laundry detergent for space
item.description: Today’s headlines: Finally, thanks to Tide, there's a laundry detergent for space, Peloton is coming for your company's fitness plan and Oculus loses one of its first in-app VR ad partners following user backlash.

item.title: Microsoft adds photo editing features to OneDrive
item.description: Microsoft has updated OneDrive on Android and the web with new photo editing and viewing features.

item.title: Lenovo's ThinkPad X1 Extreme fits RTX 3080 graphics into a slim body
item.description: Lenovo has unveiled its 4th-generation flagship ThinkPad X1 Extreme laptop, along with new AMD models and Chromebooks.

item.title: Xbox Cloud Gaming's next-gen upgrade begins rolling out
item.description: Some Microsoft xCloud games are already being powered by Xbox Series hardware as part of an update to the company's datacenters.

item.title: SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet could achieve global coverage by September
item.description: SpaceX president Gwynne Shotwell has revealed that Starlink will be able to offer continuous global coverage as soon as September.

item.title: Spin's new e-scooter is designed to withstand the public's neglect
item.description: The scooters have sturdier bodies, swappable batteries and a more modular design.

item.title: The 'Borderlands' movie is done filming
item.description: It's a wrap for the Borderlands movie production, now that the cast and crew are done with principal photography.

item.title: Microsoft will end expanded 'Cyberpunk 2077' refund policy in July
item.description: Cyberpunk 2077 will fall back under Microsoft's standard digital refund policy starting on July 6th.

item.title: Nextdoor can help you find and book COVID-19 vaccinations
item.description: Nextdoor becomes the latest company to launch a tool to help Americans find a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Twitter for iOS supports sending tweets to Instagram Stories
item.description: You don't need to screenshot a tweet anymore if you want to share it on Instagram Stories.

item.title: 'Minecraft' is getting Sonic the Hedgehog DLC
item.description: Just in time for the hedgehog’s 30th birthday on June 23rd, Mojang is releasing Sonic-themed DLC for its immensely popular sandbox title.
